thread.title: Seahawks lift Coleman suspension, re-sign Lemuel Jeanpierre
thread.title_full: Seahawks lift Coleman suspension, re-sign Lemuel Jeanpierre

title: Seahawks lift Coleman suspension, re-sign Lemuel Jeanpierre
text:
Seahawks lift Coleman suspension, re-sign Lemuel Jeanpierre Coleman was suspended last week following an alleged hit and run in Bellevue. Post to Facebook Seahawks lift Coleman suspension, re-sign Lemuel Jeanpierre Coleman was suspended last week following an alleged hit and run in Bellevue. Check out this story on KING5.com: http://www.king5.com/story/sports/nfl/seahawks/2015/10/20/seahawks-lift-coleman-suspension-re-sign-lemuel-jeanpierre/74294458/ Cancel Send A link has been sent to your friend's email address. Posted! A link has been posted to your Facebook feed. Join the Conversation To find out more about Facebook commenting please read the Conversation Guidelines and FAQs Seahawks lift Coleman suspension, re-sign Lemuel Jeanpierre Travis Pittman, KING 5 News 3:03 p.m. PDT October 20, 2015 Fullback Derrick Coleman #40 of the Seattle Seahawks carries the ball as outside linebacker David Hawthorne #57 of the New Orleans Saints defends during a game at CenturyLink Field on December 2, 2013 in Seattle, Washington. (Photo: Jonathan Ferrey, Getty Images) CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
SEATTLE – The Seahawks re-activated fullback Derrick Coleman to the 53-man roster Tuesday and added offensive line depth by signing center Lemuel Jeanpierre. 
Coleman was suspended last week following an alleged hit and run in Bellevue. He’s under investigation for vehicular assault and felony hit and run but prosecutors say it could be several weeks before a decision on charges. 
Coleman could play Thursday night at San Francisco, but the Seahawks said team doctors need to check him out first. 
Jeanpierre has played for the Seahawks since 2011. He was released last season only to be brought back due to injuries on the offensive line. That’s the likely reason he’s back again – due to some doubt that Patrick Lewis will be ready to play Thursday because of an ankle injury. 
Lemuel Jeanpierre #61 of the Seattle Seahawks starts the snap against the San Francisco 49ers in the fourth quarter at Levi's Stadium on November 27, 2014 in Santa Clara, California. (Photo: Brian Bahr, Getty Images) 
Cornerback Crezdon Butler, who was signed last week, was waived to make room on the roster. 
Linebacker Brock Coyle was placed on injured reserve/designated to return. He will not be able to play for eight weeks. 
It’s still not clear if linebacker Bobby Wagner, who has an injured pectoral, will be ready Thursday. 
Rookie cornerback Tye Smith is expected to play after recovering from a hip injury. Read or Share this story: http://www.king5.com/story/sports/nfl/seahawks/2015/10/20/seahawks-lift-coleman-suspension-re-sign-lemuel-jeanpierre/74294458/ TOP VIDEOS
